job_tasks.phrase: continuously improving the current infrastructure landscape by automation and the use of new technologies.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes ongoing efforts to enhance and automate the existing infrastructure, which falls under the operational aspects of managing and improving systems.

job_tasks.phrase: support the team in building and expanding (new) systems and platforms
job_tasks.justification: This refers to the core engineering task of creating and growing systems and platforms, which is a fundamental software development activity.
This describes the continuous improvement and maintenance of the operational infrastructure.

job_tasks.phrase: the infra delivery to our internal customers
job_tasks.justification: This relates to the delivery of infrastructure services, which is a form of integration and service provision within a software engineering context.

job_tasks.phrase: carrying out life cycle management of systems and software.
job_tasks.justification: Lifecycle management of systems and software is a key operational responsibility, ensuring systems are maintained, updated, and eventually retired.

soft_skills.phrase: You are responsible for your own development, so you decide how, what and when you develop yourself!
You are in the lead, so old fashion evaluation and performance interviews are not our way of working. You make sure that your manager and your colleagues know your goals and development requests.
you have to take initiative yourself. Be enthusiastic! Is something missing or could something be better? Go ahead, do it differently.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement describes a Linux Engineer role focused on infrastructure improvement, automation, and system lifecycle management. None of the tasks or technologies mentioned relate to Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or Generative AI. Therefore, the role does not fit any of the AI/ML-centric profiles and is classified as 'Not Relevant' to the scope of this coding book.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear about the nature of the role (Linux Engineer) and its responsibilities (infrastructure, automation, lifecycle management). There is absolutely no ambiguity or mention of AI/ML, making the classification straightforward.
